title: No email about email change
body: So I recently got hacked and riot sent me nothing about how my email or password changed is this normal  and how come they dont have any security about it such as if someone request a email change they need a code from an email that was sent to your email

replies.body:
Riot doesn't currently have 2 factor authentication. Believe me it's something we all want, and certain Rioters are pushing for it as hard as they can, but it's still a soon (TM) kinda project.

If you haven't yet gone through the account recovery process you can do so by submitting a ticket to player support (I need help recovering my account):
https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new
Been trying to recover my account for the past week but cant remember old details that i did like 8 years ago

Doesn't have to be stuff from 8 years ago, the questions they give you are essentially a guide. Any information that is unique to the account but not visible on it. 

Say you remember buying SKT Zac the day it came out, or maybe you know Annie in Wonderland was a mystery gift (bonus points if you know from who). Maybe you know you bought Jinx with RP because you were so hyped for her and didn't have enough IP.

Maybe, you bought all your RP with prepaid cards and you still have some of them lying around somewhere, or maybe you always used paypal.

Any details on sources of skins/champs/payments and any more specific times of purchase you can give (has to be better than just a year for skins because you can see that on the account) are all incredibly useful, even if you only go a year or so back. Basically it just has to be stuff at least older than 30 days (purchase history) and also acquired before the compromise).
I've told them stuff like that but they replied with " it only shows that you played the account and dont have enough evidence showing that you are the original owner "

If they're saying you don't have enough info then you don't have enough info.You need to give them enough to prove that you are the original owner and not someone who ended up with the account through other means.
That is why i said i cant remember things from 8 years ago eg first 5 champions purchased, what i used my refund tokens on and such .

Which is precisely why I said it doesn't have to be stuff from 8 years ago... I gave you a whole list of examples in my first response of what info you can give them that is helpful but doesn't come from 8 years ago. The further back you can go the better, but there's plenty you can give them that's more recent.
Wouldnt anyone on the account be able to see that ? how does what you listed show you that im the original owner of the account
How are they going to see that information? Purchase history only goes back a month.
But how does that show im the original owner of the account ?

If you can't remember at least one or two even general things from them creation of the account then it doesn't, but it strengthens the claim that it's your account, and if support has no reason to believe the account has ever changed hands voluntarily, then it's more info for them to prove that it's your account.
